Definition of the variable: Unique ID identifies each unique film. If a film appeared in more than one sample festivals, it will be assigned one unique ID, regardless of the number of appearances and screenings.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: ID was assigned during data processing

Definition of the variable: If available, ID assigned by the International Movie database as of December 2020.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Created after identification of films on IMDb

Definition of the variable: Unique ID identifies a unique film festival. If a festival appeared in more than one year, it will be assigned one unique ID, regardless of the number of year edditions.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: ID was assigned during data processing

Definition of the variable: Title of the film as appeared in the program (i.e., while most of the titles are in english, it can also be in other languages).
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Title identified in the given festival program
Coding: title as identified in the given festival program

Definition of the variable: Standardized name of a festival
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Title assigned during the standartisation of the festival name
Coding: title assigned during the standartisation of the festival name

Definition of the variable: Short version of a festival name for to make visualization easier
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year

Definition of the variable: Name of a festival as listed on IMDb (not standardized, so the same festival can have differenet name versions)
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Festival name as stated on IMDb
Coding: Festival name as stated on IMDb

Definition of the variable: Year edition of the festival listed in fest.name, fest.label, and event.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: Year as enetered on IMDb limited to 2019. No data after 2019 were collected.

Definition of the variable: Month of the festival listed in fest.name, fest.label, and event.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Month as enetered on IMDb. Where possible missing data were replaced by the data from Festival Library and web search.
Coding: Month as enetered on IMDb. Where possible missing data were replaced by the data from Festival Library and web search.
Source of missing values: no data on festival's moth were available

Definition of the variable: Date of the festival listed in fest.name, fest.label, and event.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Date as enetered on IMDb. Where possible missing data were replaced by the data from Festival Library and web search.
Coding: Date as enetered on IMDb. Where possible missing data were replaced by the data from Festival Library and web search.
Source of missing values: no data on festival's date were available

Definition of the variable: Location of the festival listed in fest.name, fest.label, and event in a given year.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Country as enetred on IMDb and standardized in case of different versions of the name
Coding: Country as enetred on IMDb and standardized in case of different versions of the name

Definition of the variable: Count of unique festivals for each unique film.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Festivals listed on IMDb and standardized within the project.
Coding: Count of unique festivals for each unique film (if a films is shown at the same festival in two different years, it is counted as one unique festival).

Definition of the variable: Length of the festival run in months.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Coded based on event.year, event.month, and event.date
Coding: Coded based on event.year, event.month, and event.date
Source of missing values: no data on festival's date were available

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to OCEANIA region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to MENA region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to Subsaharan Africa region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to Central Asian and Asian region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to North American region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to European region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to Latin America and the Caribbean based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country where festival took lpace in a given year belongs to Subsaharan Africa region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Coding: 1 - counrty belongs to the regions, 0 - country does not belong to the region

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a film has only festival release and no other release types such as theatrical release, digital release, TV, DVD and blue ray.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Coded based on release data as entered in IMDb
Coding: 1 - film has only festival release, 0 - film has other releases as well (theatrical and/or, digital, and/or tv, and/or dvd and blue ray)

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a film has limited or nationwide theatrical release.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Coded based on release data as entered in IMDb
Coding: 1 - film has theatrical release, 0 - film has no theatrical release

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a film has digital release.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Coded based on release data as entered in IMDb
Coding: 1 - film has digital release, 0 - film has no digital release

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a festival has a TV release.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Coded based on release data as entered in IMDb
Coding: 1 - film has TV release, 0 - film has no TV release

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a film has DVD and/or blue ray release
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: Coded based on release data as entered in IMDb
Coding: 1 - film has dvd/blue ray release, 0 - film has no dvd/blue ray release

Definition of the variable: Binary gender was assigned to directors based on their first names using the GenderizeR application. 16 % of films had more than one director, hence gender composition is reported for a director team.
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's appearance in first screening in a given festival in a given year
Data Source: IMDb name data on crew members and GenderizeR data.
Coding: at least one unknown name - GenderizeR could not assign gender for at least one director in a team of directors, female only - only female directors, male only - only female directors, mixed gender - both female and male directors in case of more than one director for a given film
Value ranges: at least one unknown name, female only, male only, mixed gender
Source of missing values: no data on names of directors on IMDb

Definition of the variable: Language of a specified title on IMDb
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's title in a spesified language

Definition of the variable: Film title in other languages as specified on IMDb
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's title in a spesified language

Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award

Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award

Definition of the variable: Year when award is awarded including both winners and nominated films.

Definition of the variable: Indicate if it is a nomination or a film won a given award.

Coding: Coded based on data provided on IMDb

Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award

Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award

Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award or crew member per film

Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award or crew member per film

Definition of the variable: Probability of how correct the assigned gender is
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award or crew member per film

Definition of the variable: Number of obervations with this name in the GenderizeR data
Units of measurement: each row corresponds to film's award or crew member per film
